languages.text: Это был последний раз, когда я видел капитана Сойера. Обломав зубы о первый штурм, наспех залатанный бинтами, на которых еще не успела запечься кровь, капитан, получив приказ, рьяно захромал в командную ставку. Свидетельств очевидцев о том, что стало с капитаном Сойером нет, лишь слухи и досужие домыслы — вокруг бушевала война, а на войне в пропаже людей нет ничего удивительного. Но ради исторической достоверности я приведу их здесь, чтобы вы знали на какие кривотолки способны измученные солдаты перед лицом неописуемых ужасов Архиврага.

That was the last time I saw Captain Sawyer. With a figurative bloodied nose from the first assault, as well as actual blood still fresh on his bandages, the hastily patched-up captain limped eagerly toward the command HQ upon receiving the order. There are no eyewitness accounts of what happened to Captain Sawyer — only rumours and speculation. War was raging all around and someone going missing is never a surprise in wartime. But for the sake of historical accuracy, I am going to cite them here, to give you an idea of the far-fetched tales that can be bred by the minds of worn-out soldiers faced with the unspeakable horrors of the Archenemy.
languages.original_text: Это был последний раз, когда я видел капитана Сойера. Обломав зубы о первый штурм, наспех залатанный бинтами, на которых еще не успела запечься кровь, капитан, получив приказ, рьяно захромал в командную ставку. languages.text: 那时我最后一次见到索耶上尉。第一波进攻期间，上尉的鼻子被打坏了，绷带沾满了上尉干涸的血迹。他接到命令之后，便带着匆忙包扎的绷带，一瘸一拐地走向了指挥中心。没人知道索耶上尉遭遇了什么事情，只有谣言和猜测。战争期间，有人失踪并不是什么令人意外的事情，但为了准确地还原当时的情形，我准备把那些传言如实记录下来。这么做是为了让所有人看到，当那些疲惫不堪的士兵面对混沌大敌的恐怖时，脑子里会编造出多么牵强附会的阴谋论调。
languages.original_text: That was the last time I saw Captain Sawyer. There are no eyewitness accounts of what happened to Captain Sawyer — only rumours and speculation. War was raging all around and someone going missing is never a surprise in wartime. But for the sake of historical accuracy, I am going to cite them here, to give you an idea of the far-fetched tales that can be bred by the minds of worn-out soldiers faced with the unspeakable horrors of the Archenemy.

languages.text: Da habe ich Captain Sawyer das letzte Mal gesehen. Der Captain hatte sich im ersten Angriff bildlich gesprochen eine blutige Nase geholt, seine Verbände waren aber auch von frischem echtem Blut getränkt. Eilig zusammengeflickt humpelte er zur Befehlszentrale, sobald er den Befehl erhalten hatte. Es gibt keine Augenzeugenberichte, was mit Captain Sawyer geschehen ist. Nur Gerüchte und Spekulationen. Der Krieg tobte überall, und in Kriegszeiten verschwinden immer wieder Leute. Im Sinne der historischen Präzision führe ich diese Gerüchte hier aber auf, um Euch einen Eindruck von den abstrusen Geschichten zu geben, die in den Köpfen erschöpfter Soldaten entstehen, die mit den unaussprechlichen Gräueltaten des Erzfeinds konfrontiert sind.
languages.original_text: That was the last time I saw Captain Sawyer. With a figurative bloodied nose from the first assault, as well as actual blood still fresh on his bandages, the hastily patched-up captain limped eagerly toward the command HQ upon receiving the order. But for the sake of historical accuracy, I am going to cite them here, to give you an idea of the far-fetched tales that can be bred by the minds of worn-out soldiers faced with the unspeakable horrors of the Archenemy.

languages.text: Aquella fue la última vez que vi al capitán Sawyer. Con el proverbial rabo entre las piernas (que además tenía cubiertas de vendajes ensangrentados, estos ya de verdad), al recibir la orden el capitán se dirigió al centro de mando, cojeando y a medio remendar. No existen relatos presenciales de lo que ocurrió al capitán Sawyer; tan solo rumores y conjeturas. En tiempos de guerra, no es ninguna sorpresa que la gente desaparezca. Pero en aras del rigor histórico citaré esas habladurías aquí, para dar una idea de los disparates que llega a pergeñar la fatigada mente de la soldadesca cuando se enfrenta a los inefables horrores del Archienemigo.
languages.original_text: That was the last time I saw Captain Sawyer. With a figurative bloodied nose from the first assault, as well as actual blood still fresh on his bandages, the hastily patched-up captain limped eagerly toward the command HQ upon receiving the order. There are no eyewitness accounts of what happened to Captain Sawyer — only rumours and speculation. War was raging all around and someone going missing is never a surprise in wartime. But for the sake of historical accuracy, I am going to cite them here, to give you an idea of the far-fetched tales that can be bred by the minds of worn-out soldiers faced with the unspeakable horrors of the Archenemy.

Con el proverbial rabo entre las piernas (que además tenía cubiertas de vendajes ensangrentados, estos ya de verdad), al recibir la orden el capitán se dirigió al centro de mando, cojeando y a medio remendar. No existen relatos presenciales de lo que ocurrió al capitán Sawyer; tan solo rumores y conjeturas. En tiempos de guerra, no es ninguna sorpresa que la gente desaparezca. Pero en aras del rigor histórico citaré esas habladurías aquí, para dar una idea de los disparates que llega a pergeñar la fatigada mente de la soldadesca cuando se enfrenta a los inefables horrores del Archienemigo.

languages.text: Lorsque j'ai vu le capitaine Sawyer pour la dernière fois, son sang rougissait encore les bandages recouvrant les blessures subies lors du premier assaut. Malgré son état, c'est avec enthousiasme qu'il s'est rendu en boitillant au poste de commandement dès qu'il en a reçu l'ordre. Personne n'a été témoin de ce qu'il est advenu du capitaine Sawyer ; seules nous sont parvenues des rumeurs et spéculations. Quand la guerre fait rage, les disparitions n'ont rien de surprenant. Cependant, par souci d'exactitude historique, je vais rapporter ces rumeurs ici, afin de vous donner une idée des inventions farfelues qui peuvent naître dans l'esprit de soldats épuisés face à l'horreur insoutenable du Grand Ennemi.
languages.original_text: That was the last time I saw Captain Sawyer. With a figurative bloodied nose from the first assault, as well as actual blood still fresh on his bandages, the hastily patched-up captain limped eagerly toward the command HQ upon receiving the order. There are no eyewitness accounts of what happened to Captain Sawyer — only rumours and speculation. War was raging all around and someone going missing is never a surprise in wartime. But for the sake of historical accuracy, I am going to cite them here, to give you an idea of the far-fetched tales that can be bred by the minds of worn-out soldiers faced with the unspeakable horrors of the Archenemy.

traits.locale_text: Lorsque j'ai vu le capitaine Sawyer pour la dernière fois, son sang rougissait encore les bandages recouvrant les blessures subies lors du premier assaut sur lequel il s'était cassé les dents. Malgré son état, c'est avec enthousiasme qu'il s'est rendu en boitillant au poste de commandement dès qu'il en a reçu l'ordre. Personne n'a été témoin de ce qu'il est advenu du capitaine Sawyer ; seules nous sont parvenues des rumeurs et spéculations. Quand la guerre fait rage, les disparitions n'ont rien de surprenant. Cependant, par souci d'exactitude historique, je vais rapporter ces rumeurs ici, afin de vous donner une idée des inventions farfelues qui peuvent naître dans l'esprit de soldats épuisés face à l'horreur insoutenable du Grand Ennemi.

languages.text: それがソイヤー中隊長を見た最後だった。最初の襲撃からの鼻血と、包帯にもまだ鮮血がついたままのソイヤー中隊長は、命令を受けて急いで手当てをし、足を引きずりながら司令部に向かった。ソイヤー中隊長に何が起こったのか、目撃証言はなく、噂と憶測があるのみだった。戦争はいたるところで激化しており、戦時中に誰かが行方不明になることは何ら驚くべきことではない。しかし、歴史の正確さを期すため、ここにそれらを引用し、渾沌の勢力の言葉では表せない恐怖に直面し、疲れ果てた兵士たちの心が生み出す奇想天外な物語を知っていただこうと思う。
languages.original_text: That was the last time I saw Captain Sawyer. With a figurative bloodied nose from the first assault, as well as actual blood still fresh on his bandages, the hastily patched-up captain limped eagerly toward the command HQ upon receiving the order. There are no eyewitness accounts of what happened to Captain Sawyer — only rumours and speculation. War was raging all around and someone going missing is never a surprise in wartime. But for the sake of historical accuracy, I am going to cite them here, to give you an idea of the far-fetched tales that can be bred by the minds of worn-out soldiers faced with the unspeakable horrors of the Archenemy.
